name: Origins
description: Everything begins. Fantastic Four #1 launches the Marvel Universe in November 1961. Within two years, Spider-Man, Hulk, Thor, Iron Man, Ant-Man, and the Avengers all debut. Stan Lee and Jack Kirby are building a universe in real time.

name: The Universe Expands
description: The Marvel Universe deepens with new heroes and interconnected continuity. X-Men, Doctor Strange, Daredevil, and Nick Fury debut. Characters cross over between titles regularly — the shared universe concept takes hold.

name: Cosmic Horizon
description: Kirby and Lee push Marvel's scope from street-level to cosmic. The Galactus Trilogy introduces the Devourer of Worlds and the Silver Surfer. The Inhumans emerge. Black Panther debuts as the first Black superhero in mainstream comics. The Marvel Universe is no longer just New York — it's infinite.

name: Beyond the Capes
description: Marvel's Silver Age wasn't only superheroes. Romance, westerns, war, and humor titles filled the line alongside the capes. Patsy Walker's romance comics would later feed into the Hellcat superhero identity. Rawhide Kid brought Kirby's dynamism to the frontier. These genre titles round out the full picture of Marvel's earliest publishing landscape.

name: Peak Kirby
description: Jack Kirby reaches the zenith of his cosmic imagination. Adam Warlock (Him) is created. Annihilus debuts. The Psycho-Man and the Microverse expand Marvel's reality. Kirby's art grows increasingly abstract and powerful.

name: The Silver Surfer Soars
description: Silver Surfer gets his own series exploring philosophical themes of freedom and imprisonment. Captain America confronts the political upheaval of the late 1960s. The Kree-Skrull conflict deepens. Marvel gets literary ambitions.

name: End of the Beginning
description: The founding era closes. Kirby departs for DC after disputes over credit and compensation — one of comics' great tragedies. Lee transitions to publisher. A new generation of creators inherits a universe.

name: Genre Expansion
description: Marvel pushes beyond superheroes into horror, sword-and-sorcery, humor, and team-up formats. Conan the Barbarian launches Marvel's first major licensed property. Marvel Horror explores the supernatural. Not Brand Echh lampoons the very universe Marvel is building. Marvel Two-In-One pairs the Thing with every hero imaginable. The Conway/Kane Spider-Man run bridges eras with the death of Gwen Stacy. These genre-crossing titles prove Marvel's universe can contain multitudes.

name: The Relevance Revolution
description: Marvel tackles the real world head-on. Drug issues in Amazing Spider-Man without Comics Code approval. Luke Cage debuts as the first Black hero with his own title. Kree-Skrull War elevates the Avengers to cosmic scope. Marvel grows up.

name: A New Generation
description: Marvel diversifies its lineup with groundbreaking new characters. Blade the vampire hunter, Shang-Chi master of kung fu, Iron Fist, and the Defenders. Tomb of Dracula becomes a horror masterpiece. Comics reflect the exploitation film era with style.

name: Cosmic Reckoning
description: Jim Starlin reinvents cosmic Marvel. Adam Warlock battles the Magus and the Universal Church of Truth. Thanos obsesses over Death. The Korvac Saga pushes the Avengers into a cosmic war. These stories plant seeds that won't fully bloom until Infinity Gauntlet in 1991.

name: Bronze Twilight
description: The Bronze Age winds down with landmark runs wrapping up. Spider-Man faces his greatest challenge yet. The Avengers reach the Korvac Saga's emotional peak. Frank Miller begins transforming Daredevil from a B-lister into Marvel's grittiest street hero.

name: Sci-Fi, Fantasy & The Fringe
description: The Bronze Age explodes with experimental, genre-bending titles that push Marvel far beyond traditional capes-and-tights. Jack Kirby returns to create Machine Man and Devil Dinosaur. Killraven fights in a post-apocalyptic Earth. Deathlok pioneers cyberpunk a decade before Neuromancer. The Champions try a West Coast team concept. What If? explores alternate realities. The Invaders revisit WWII. Super-Villain Team-Up gives Doom and Namor the spotlight. Red Sonja carries the sword-and-sorcery banner. These titles represent Marvel's most adventurous creative impulses.

name: The All-New, All-Different X-Men
description: Giant-Size X-Men #1 relaunches the team with Wolverine, Storm, Colossus, Nightcrawler, and Banshee. Chris Claremont begins his legendary run. The new team struggles with diversity, loss (Thunderbird dies in issue #2), and emerging threats. The X-Men become Marvel's most important franchise.

name: The Phoenix Saga
description: Jean Grey becomes Phoenix. The Hellfire Club manipulates her into Dark Phoenix. The X-Men fight to save Jean, but she sacrifices herself on the moon. The Dark Phoenix Saga is the most important X-Men story ever told — and arguably the most important single storyline in Marvel history.

name: The Byrne Revolution
description: John Byrne defines two franchises simultaneously. Days of Future Past changes the X-Men forever. Byrne takes over Fantastic Four and delivers a run rivaling Lee/Kirby. The Brood Saga introduces xenomorphic horror. God Loves, Man Kills becomes a template for X-Men films.

name: Secret Wars and Beyond
description: Marvel launches its first mega-crossover. The Beyonder teleports heroes and villains to Battleworld. Spider-Man gets the black costume (future Venom). Thor gets his Simonson run — the definitive take. Daredevil reaches its Miller peak. Everything escalates.

name: The Mutant Crossover Machine
description: X-Men crossovers become annual events. Mutant Massacre kills the Morlocks and cripples the team. Fall of the Mutants scatters them. Inferno brings Hell to Manhattan. Each year's crossover is bigger and darker. The formula is addictive — and exhausting.

name: The Cosmic Return
description: Jim Starlin returns to Marvel cosmic. Silver Surfer is relaunched. Thanos Quest has the Mad Titan collecting all six Infinity Gems. Then comes Infinity Gauntlet — the snap heard across the universe. Cosmic Marvel reaches its highest peak since Kirby.

name: McFarlane's Spider-Man
description: Todd McFarlane reinvents Spider-Man's visual language with his hyper-detailed art and impossibly intricate webbing. Venom becomes a superstar villain. McFarlane launches a new Spider-Man title that breaks sales records. The 90s style arrives — and soon, so does the exodus.

name: Avengers & Earth's Mightiest
description: While X-Men crossovers and cosmic events dominate the headlines, the Avengers face their own gauntlet. Under Siege devastates the team. Acts of Vengeance unites every villain. West Coast Avengers fractures the Vision and Scarlet Witch. Iron Man fights Armor Wars. Squadron Supreme asks what happens when heroes go too far. And Byrne reinvents She-Hulk and Namor.

name: Peter David's Incredible Hulk
description: Peter David writes the longest and most acclaimed Hulk run in history, transforming Bruce Banner's multiple personalities from a gimmick into genuine psychological depth. The Grey Hulk becomes Joe Fixit, the Professor Hulk merges all identities, and Future Imperfect creates the Maestro. An essential character study spanning nearly a decade.

name: Street-Level and the Dark Side
description: The Event Age's grittier side. Daredevil post-Miller enters its underrated Nocenti era. Punisher becomes a three-title franchise. Moon Knight, Ghost Rider, and Elektra push Marvel into darker territory. The Midnight Sons unite supernatural heroes against Lilith. Wolverine gets his Weapon X origin. This is the Marvel that lives in the shadows between crossover events.

name: A New Generation of Heroes
description: As the Event Age peaks, a wave of new young heroes launches. New Warriors, Darkhawk, Sleepwalker, and Speedball represent the next generation. Spider-Man 2099 imagines Marvel's future. Deadpool debuts in New Mutants #98. Damage Control satirizes it all. These launches capture the energy of the era's peak -- and foreshadow the coming crash.

name: The Image Exodus
description: Todd McFarlane, Jim Lee, Rob Liefeld, and other top artists leave Marvel to found Image Comics. Marvel loses its visual stars overnight. X-Men #1 (by Lee) had sold 8 million copies in 1991 — now Lee is drawing WildCATs. Marvel scrambles to fill the void.

name: Age of Apocalypse
description: A creative bright spot in a dark era. Every X-Men title is replaced for four months with its Age of Apocalypse counterpart. A world where Xavier died before founding the X-Men. Magneto leads. Apocalypse rules. Bold, imaginative, and refreshingly different from the dross around it.

name: The Clone Saga and the Crash
description: The Clone Saga spirals out of control — a six-month story stretched to two years. Ben Reilly, Scarlet Spider, baby kidnappings, and editorial chaos. Meanwhile, the speculator market collapses. Comics shops close by the thousands. Marvel files for bankruptcy in December 1996.

name: Avengers in Crisis
description: The Avengers family navigates the speculator crash. The Gatherers threaten from alternate realities. Iron Man goes through the disastrous Crossing storyline. War Machine and Thunderstrike spin off. Force Works tries to reinvent West Coast Avengers. Amid the chaos, genuine gems emerge: Marvels reimagines Marvel history, Thunderbolts delivers the decade's greatest twist, and Marvel vs DC makes fanboy dreams real.

name: Onslaught
description: The psychic entity born from Xavier's dark side and Magneto's rage erupts as a universe-level threat. Onslaught draws in every major Marvel hero. The Avengers, Fantastic Four, and other non-mutant heroes sacrifice themselves to stop him. Franklin Richards saves their essence in a pocket universe. The stage is set for Heroes Reborn.

name: The Pocket Universe
description: After Onslaught kills the non-mutant heroes, Marvel farms out Avengers, FF, Iron Man, and Cap to Image founders Jim Lee and Rob Liefeld. They're reborn in a pocket universe. Sales are strong. Quality is... variable. Liefeld is fired from his books mid-run.

name: Heroes Return
description: The heroes return to the main universe with relaunched titles. Kurt Busiek and George Pérez take over Avengers and deliver a run for the ages. Heroes Reborn was the experiment — Heroes Return proves the originals are still the best.

name: Marvel Knights
description: Joe Quesada and Jimmy Palmiotti curate Marvel Knights, pairing A-list talent with B-list characters. Kevin Smith on Daredevil. Christopher Priest on Black Panther. The results are electric — grounded, cinematic, and stylish. Marvel remembers how to tell great stories.

name: Literary Ambition
description: Marvel courts literary credibility. Bendis reinvents Daredevil as a crime noir masterpiece. Grant Morrison deconstructs the X-Men in New X-Men. Jeph Loeb and Tim Sale deliver Daredevil: Yellow and Spider-Man: Blue. Comics aim for the bookshelf, not just the longbox.

name: The Ultimate Universe
description: Ultimate Spider-Man and The Ultimates reimagine Marvel for the 21st century. Bendis writes a teenager Peter Parker for modern times. Millar and Hitch create a widescreen action Avengers that becomes the template for the MCU. Ultimate X-Men strips mutants to essentials.

name: The Avengers Renaissance
description: Busiek and Perez restore the Avengers to glory after Heroes Return, then Geoff Johns brings his character-driven approach. The Kang Dynasty stands as the definitive Kang story. Iron Man gets the Extremis upgrade that defines Tony Stark for the MCU era.

name: Spider-Man Reinvented
description: J. Michael Straczynski revitalizes Spider-Man with mystical totemic connections and the unforgettable villain Morlun. Mark Millar pits Spidey against every villain in his rogues gallery in Marvel Knights. Kevin Smith's delayed mini-series and the Runaways add new dimensions.

name: The Punisher's War
description: Garth Ennis transforms the Punisher from a joke into the definitive anti-hero. The Marvel Knights run brings darkly comic ultraviolence, then the MAX imprint strips away all superhero trappings for the most brutally realistic crime comics Marvel has ever published.

name: Fantastic Four by Waid
description: Mark Waid and Mike Wieringo deliver a modern Fantastic Four masterpiece. 'Unthinkable' redefines Doctor Doom by having him sacrifice everything for dark sorcery. 'Authoritative Action' sees the team overthrow Latveria. Supreme Power reimagines the Squadron Supreme under the MAX imprint.

name: X-Men Evolution
description: Beyond Morrison's New X-Men, the mutant line expands with new students at Xavier's Academy, Whedon's celebrated Astonishing run, the reality-hopping Exiles, and the odd-couple pairing of Cable and Deadpool. X-23 makes her comics debut in NYX.

name: The Wider MKU World
description: The Marvel Knights and Ultimate era produces a wealth of character-driven titles beyond the major franchises. The Hulk becomes a fugitive thriller. Wolverine goes to war. Origin stories, reimagined heroes, and bold experiments fill out the era.

name: Disassembled
description: Bendis tears down the Avengers to rebuild them. Scarlet Witch destroys Avengers Mansion. Hawkeye, Vision, and Ant-Man die. The team disbands. Then New Avengers assembles a street-level squad: Spider-Man, Wolverine, Luke Cage. Everything changes.

name: House of M to Civil War
description: Two paradigm-shifting events. Scarlet Witch says 'No More Mutants' and decimates the mutant population. Then the Superhuman Registration Act splits every hero in two — Iron Man vs. Captain America. Spider-Man unmasks. Cap surrenders and is assassinated. Marvel will never be the same.

name: Dark Reign
description: Norman Osborn runs America. The villains are in charge. Secret Invasion exposes the Skrull infiltration. Osborn kills the Skrull Queen on live TV and becomes the hero. Dark Avengers wear stolen costumes. Real heroes are fugitives. It ends with Siege — the Avengers reunite to take down Osborn.

name: The Heroic Age
description: After years of darkness, Marvel goes optimistic. Steve Rogers returns. The registration act is repealed. Three Avengers teams run simultaneously. But tensions simmer — the Phoenix is coming, and Cyclops won't let anyone take Hope Summers. Avengers vs. X-Men ends this era in fire.

name: Cosmic Renaissance
description: While Bendis reshapes Earth, Dan Abnett and Andy Lanning (DnA) revitalize Marvel cosmic. Annihilation proves cosmic can outsell events. Nova becomes an A-lister. Star-Lord assembles the Guardians of the Galaxy. The Cancerverse threatens all reality. This run directly inspires the GotG films.

name: The Mutant Messiah Trilogy
description: After House of M decimates the mutant population, the X-Men fight for survival. Messiah CompleX finds the first mutant born since M-Day. Messiah War spans timelines. Second Coming brings Hope Summers home. The path from decimation to the Phoenix is the X-Men's defining arc of the era.

name: The Ultimate Universe Endgame
description: The Ultimate Universe hurtles toward its apocalyptic end. Ultimatum devastates the Ultimate heroes. Hickman takes over the Ultimates with cosmic-scale storytelling. The seeds of destruction that lead to Secret Wars (2015) are planted here.

name: Deep Cuts and Hidden Gems
description: The Bendis Avengers era produces an astonishing range of character-driven books beyond the major events. Doctor Doom's origin retold. The Kang saga collected. Black Panther continues under Hudlin. Marvel Zombies becomes a phenomenon. The era's depth goes far beyond its headline crossovers.

name: The Fantastic Foundation
description: Hickman begins his grand design with the Fantastic Four. The Council of Reeds — infinite Reed Richards across the multiverse. The War of Four Cities. Johnny Storm dies. The Future Foundation is born. Every single thread Hickman lays here connects to the end of everything.

name: Everything Dies
description: Hickman takes over Avengers and New Avengers simultaneously. The Avengers expand to a massive roster. The Illuminati discover incursions — parallel Earths colliding and destroying each other. The multiverse is dying. Infinity brings Thanos to Earth's door. The Illuminati's dark secret — they're destroying other Earths to save their own.

name: Time Runs Out
description: Eight months into the future. The Avengers have shattered. Steve Rogers hunts Tony Stark. Namor allies with Thanos's Cabal. The multiverse countdown reaches zero. Everything dies. Doom salvages fragments of dead realities and builds Battleworld. God Emperor Doom rules. Reed Richards challenges him. The multiverse is reborn.

name: The X-Men Schism
description: Wolverine and Cyclops split the X-Men. Schism draws the battle lines. Uncanny X-Force is the best X-book of the decade. Avengers vs. X-Men brings the Phoenix home. Uncanny Avengers unites the teams. Magneto, Cyclops, and Storm go solo. The mutant line fractures and reforms.

name: Street-Level Renaissance
description: While Hickman goes cosmic, the street level of Marvel has a golden age of its own. Mark Waid makes Daredevil joyful again. Matt Fraction reinvents Hawkeye as a slice-of-life masterpiece. Superior Spider-Man puts Doc Ock in the driver's seat. She-Hulk opens a law practice. The era proves superhero comics can be anything.

name: Thor, Hulk, and Cosmic Threads
description: Jason Aaron begins the Thor saga that will span a decade and redefine the God of Thunder. Mark Waid makes the Hulk a SHIELD asset. Silver Surfer gets a whimsical cosmic road trip. Loki reinvents himself as an agent of Asgard. The Guardians go mainstream. Cosmic Marvel enters its most diverse phase.

name: Events and Crossovers
description: The Hickman era is punctuated by major events beyond Hickman's own. Fear Itself brings Asgardian terror. Age of Ultron fractures the multiverse. Original Sin reveals Marvel's deepest secrets. Each event reshapes the landscape that Hickman's endgame will ultimately destroy.

name: Young Heroes and New Legacies
description: A new generation rises. Kamala Khan becomes Ms. Marvel — the most important new character in a decade. Miles Morales inherits the Spider-Man mantle. Young Avengers get a stylish Gillen/McKelvie makeover. Avengers Arena puts teen heroes through a deadly gauntlet. The heroes who will inherit the Marvel Universe are forged here.

name: Avengers and Thunderbolts Extended
description: Beyond Hickman's main Avengers books, multiple teams operate in the margins. Secret Avengers runs covert ops through three writers. The Thunderbolts program continues under Jeff Parker, then goes violent under Way and Soule. Mighty Avengers serves the community. Defenders assemble one more time.

name: Solo Runs and Deep Cuts
description: The Hickman era's depth extends to solo character runs and off-the-beaten-path gems. Deadpool becomes Marvel's biggest comedy franchise. Winter Soldier goes noir. Agent Venom brings Flash Thompson into the spotlight. Captain America & Bucky revisits WWII. Alpha Flight returns. The era rewards the completionist.

name: New Legacies
description: Post-Secret Wars relaunch brings new heroes into old mantles. Jane Foster lifts Mjolnir as Thor. Miles Morales is Spider-Man in the main universe. Kamala Khan carries the Ms. Marvel legacy. Sam Wilson is Captain America. The old guard steps aside — not everyone is happy about it.

name: Civil War II and Its Fallout
description: A new hero named Ulysses can predict the future. Carol Danvers wants to use precognition to prevent crimes. Tony Stark says it's minority report. Heroes fight again. War Machine dies. Hulk (Banner) dies. Tony is left in a coma. Secret Empire follows with Hydra Captain America.

name: The Breakout Runs
description: While events divide, individual runs shine. Al Ewing begins the Immortal Hulk — a body horror reinvention that becomes the best Hulk comic ever. Donny Cates launches his Venom epic with Knull. Chip Zdarsky's Spectacular Spider-Man finds Peter Parker's humanity. Jason Aaron's Thor reaches War of the Realms.

name: The X-Men & Mutant World
description: The X-Men navigate the post-Secret Wars landscape. Bendis's time-displaced original five, Inhumans conflicts, death and rebirth of Wolverine, and the continuing mutant saga before Krakoa changes everything.

name: The Spider-Verse
description: Spider-Man and his extended family of spider-heroes across the multiverse. Spider-Verse events, solo adventures, and the expanding web of Spider-people from Gwen Stacy to Miles Morales to Spider-Man 2099.

name: Avengers & Team Books
description: The Avengers family of titles and team books outside the main events. Al Ewing's cosmic Ultimates, New Avengers AIM, Thunderbolts, West Coast Avengers, and more team dynamics in the post-Secret Wars era.

name: Street-Level Heroes & Solo Spotlights
description: Individual hero runs that define the ANAD era at street level. Daredevil, Luke Cage, Iron Fist, Jessica Jones, Black Widow, Black Panther, and the expanding roster of heroes carving out their own corners of the Marvel Universe.

name: Cosmic Marvel & The Mystic Arts
description: The cosmic and magical corners of the Marvel Universe. Doctor Strange's reinvention by Aaron and Cates, Silver Surfer's love story, Guardians of the Galaxy, Thanos across multiple eras, and the supernatural side of Marvel.

name: Venom & the Symbiote Saga
description: The Venom mythology expands through Venomverse, Al Ewing and Ram V's continuation, and the modern Venom compendium. Symbiote lore grows into cosmic horror.

name: Doom, Iron Man & Legacies of Power
description: The complicated legacies of power and technology. Doctor Doom tries heroism as Infamous Iron Man. Superior Iron Man shows Tony at his worst. Loki evolves from villain to agent of change. Vision builds a family. The question of who deserves the mantle runs through every title.

name: The Inhuman Experiment
description: Marvel's Inhuman push. Royal family in space, new Inhumans on Earth. Black Bolt's prison break, the Royals' cosmic quest, and the Death of the Inhumans that ends the era's great experiment.

name: Deadpool & Comedy Corner
description: Deadpool's rise to A-list stardom and Marvel's comedy books. Posehn and Duggan's landmark run, Gwenpool's meta-fiction, Great Lakes Avengers, Slapstick, and the funny side of the Marvel Universe.

name: Alternate Futures & What-Ifs
description: The Old Man universe and other alternate reality stories. Old Man Logan, Old Man Hawkeye, Old Man Quill, Dark Ages, History of the Marvel Universe, and stories that explore paths not taken.

name: The First Family Returns
description: Dan Slott returns the Fantastic Four to publication after their post-Secret Wars hiatus. Marvel's First Family is reunited.

name: Licensed Properties
description: Marvel's licensed comic properties including the Alien franchise, bringing horror and sci-fi universes into the Marvel publishing lineup.

name: House of X
description: Jonathan Hickman returns and shatters the X-Men paradigm. Moira MacTaggert is a reincarnating mutant. Krakoa becomes a mutant nation. Resurrection protocols conquer death. Xavier and Magneto unite. Villains are welcomed. The Quiet Council governs. Nothing about the X-Men will ever be the same.

name: Reign of X
description: Krakoa flourishes. X of Swords is the first major crossover. Hellfire Gala becomes an annual event. The Quiet Council's power plays intensify. Hickman departs but the era continues. Inferno depowers Moira. Immortal X-Men and other titles carry the torch. A.X.E.: Judgment Day forces the Avengers, X-Men, and Eternals to collide.

name: Fall of X
description: Orchis attacks during the third Hellfire Gala. Mutants are scattered. Xavier captured. Krakoa burns. The resurrection protocols are broken. Fall of X is Krakoa's darkest hour. Rise of the Powers of X and Fall of the House of X bring the era to its apocalyptic conclusion. The Krakoan experiment is over.

name: The Wider Marvel Universe
description: While Krakoa reshapes the mutant world, the rest of the Marvel Universe is having its own renaissance. Chip Zdarsky redefines Daredevil. Jed MacKay delivers a landmark Moon Knight. Donny Cates takes Thor cosmic. Al Ewing builds a Venom and Defenders mythology. Street-level, cosmic, and everything in between.

name: Blood Hunt
description: Blade turns. A vampire army blots out the sun. Earth is plunged into darkness. Doctor Strange falls. In the chaos, Doctor Doom claims the title of Sorcerer Supreme — combining magic with his technological genius. The stage is set for Doom's ultimate gambit.

name: One World Under Doom
description: Doom does what no villain has ever truly done — he wins, and he makes things better. Poverty eliminated. Disease cured. Wars ended. But freedom dies too. Heroes face the impossible question: do you fight the man who saved the world? The moral complexity of Doom's triumph is the point.

name: Spider-Man's Troubled Era
description: The controversial Zeb Wells run on Amazing Spider-Man reaches its conclusion through Dark Web, Gang War, and escalating consequences. Spider-Boy debuts. The Green Goblin's legacy haunts Peter Parker.

name: The Avengers & Solo Heroes
description: Jed MacKay shapes the Avengers roster while individual heroes carry their own titles. Captain America, Captain Marvel, Daredevil, Luke Cage, and others navigate a Marvel Universe heading toward Doom's conquest.

name: Cosmic Marvel & the Gods
description: Al Ewing's mythological Immortal Thor, Doctor Strange's final arc before Blood Hunt, Nova's return, and the cosmic side of the pre-Doom Marvel Universe.

name: Venom War & Symbiote Saga
description: The Venom mythology continues with Venom War and Carnage's evolution under Ram V. The symbiote saga's latest chapter.

name: The Fantastic Four by Ryan North
description: Ryan North's critically acclaimed Fantastic Four run continues with wit, science, and heart. Alex Ross returns for a painted sequel OGN.

name: The Ultimate Universe Reborn
description: Jonathan Hickman rebuilds the Ultimate Universe. The Maker has crafted a world without heroes, but Peter Parker, T'Challa, and mutants are rising to challenge his control.

name: X-Men: From the Ashes Begins
description: Post-Krakoa, the X-Men rebuild in the From the Ashes era. Uncanny launches. Phoenix soars solo. Forge invents. The new mutant status quo takes shape.

name: Wolverine & Licensed Horror
description: Wolverine's solo adventures including the prestige Hickman/Capullo Revenge series. Plus Marvel's Alien and Predator properties bring horror to the Marvel Universe.

name: Post-Doom
description: The Marvel Universe rebuilds after Doom's reign. New volumes of every major title launch into uncertain territory. What does freedom mean after you've tasted utopia? The status quo is fragile, and Armageddon looms.

name: Armageddon
description: Chip Zdarsky's next major event. Details still under wraps. The culmination of everything post-OWUD has been building toward. Expected to define the next era of Marvel Comics.

name: One World Under Doom Tie-Ins
description: How individual heroes experience Doom's global conquest from the inside. The Avengers fracture over whether to fight the man who saved the world. Spider-Man patrols a city where crime has vanished. Each tie-in explores the moral impossibility of opposing a benevolent dictator.

name: X-Men: From the Ashes
description: The X-Men rebuild after Krakoa's fall. Jed MacKay's flagship X-Men, Gail Simone's Uncanny in the Louisiana bayou, Storm's solo debut, and the expanding From the Ashes line redefine what it means to be a mutant without a nation.

name: The Ultimate Universe
description: Jonathan Hickman's rebuilt Ultimate Universe grows into a full publishing line. Ultimate Invasion seeds the new reality. Ultimate Spider-Man, Black Panther, X-Men, and the Ultimates challenge the Maker's invisible control.
